comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This appears to be taken at the same time (January 18, 1871) as this Bain photo of the activities outdoors at Versailles after the coronation of Wilhelm I as the first German Emperor of the empire that extended from 1871 to 1918. Another Flickr user, Miss Mertens, has scanned the original Liersch postcard in her photostream

comment.author: 98646251@N00
comment._content:
No, it is not Kaiser Wilhelm I. on the photo.
I can see following persons:
from left the women: Princess Viktoria Luise of Prussia (born 1892, 4 years after Wilhelm I. death), next to her Crown Princess Cecilie and Princess Sophie Charlotte of Prussia, wife of Prince Eitel Fritz.
The little boy was Prince Louis Ferdinand or Prince Wilhelm, son of the crown couple.
The man with Pickelhaube is not Kaiser Wilhelm II. I also don`t know, who is the wife with the dark suite!

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Thanks for that, Miss Mertens. I have changed my comment to this photo and the one, which looks like the same occasion, with Wilhelm II greeting court chaplain Bernhard Rogge.
